alert.note: Alert for Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 9:19PM EDT until July 29 at 6:44AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Licking River near Salyersville affecting Magoffin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Licking River near Salyersville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The river crested at 19.1 feet early this evening and is beginning to fall. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 7.1 feet late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.9 feet on 02/13/1966. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued by 2 AM EDT Friday morning.
